NIT Delhi Highlights 2025

National Institute of Technology Delhi (popularly known as NIT Delhi) is one of the thirty-one NIT Colleges in India that was established in 2010 by an act of parliament. It is also an Institute of National importance. Spread across 51 acres of land, the Institute is located in Narela, Delhi. NIT Delhi functions under the aegis of the Ministry of Education, Government of India. It has been ranked 45 by NIRF 2024 under the Engineering category and 22 by India Today 2024 under the Engineering category. Furthermore, NIT in Delhi is approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE).

NIT Delhi comprises several departments, through which it offers various UG, PG, and PhD programmes. NIT Delhi courses include BTech, MTech, and PhD. The institute accepts various national-level entrance exams for admission to its courses. NIT Delhi admission to the BTech and MTech programmes is based on the JEE Main and GATE scores, respectively. The institute also offers placement assistance to students. The highest package offered during NIT Delhi placement 2024 stood at INR 62 LPA and INR 15.6 LPA, respectively.

NIT Delhi cut off for the BTech programmes is based on the JEE Main scores. NIT Delhi CSE cutoff is usually the most competitive one, among all the BTech specialisations offered at the institute. Located in Delhi, this reputed NIT has a good infrastructure with hostel and mess facilities available for students. The major highlights of National Institute of Technology Delhi are tabulated below:

Q: What is the cutoff for NIT Delhi?

A: 

NIT Delhi cutoff 2024 has been released across various specialisations in opening and closing ranks. NIT Delhi BTech cutoff 2024 ranged between 7361 and 23970 for the General AI category candidates, wherein BTech in CSE is the most competitive course. The easiest BTech specialisation to secure admission in is B.Tech. in Civil Engineering. For a detailed NIT Delhi branch-wise cutoff 2024, candidates can refer to the table below for the Round 1 cutoff. The cutoff mentioned below is for the General category under the AI Quota.  

Course2024
B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering7361
B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering11537
B.Tech. in Civil Engineering23970
B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering16133
B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering19600
B.Tech.1 in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science7417
B.Tech. in Aerospace Engineering10663
B.Tech. in VLSI Design and Technology13596

Q: What is the fee for BTech at NIT Delhi?

A: 

NIT Delhi offers a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate courses to the students. At the undergraduate level, NIT Delhi offers BTech courses to students. The total tuition fee for the BTech course is INR 5 LPA. The fee is exclusive of various components such as mess charges, application fee, and other charges. For total course fee, candidates must visit the official website of the college.

Q: What is the eligibility criteria of for B.Tech course at NIT Delhi?

A: 

BTech Eligibility Criteria. Candidates seeking admission to the B.Tech programme at NIT are required to pass their 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, and English as mandatory subjects. Candidates are required to secure at least 75% and a decent JEE Main score ie. 95+ percentile for general or OBC students.

Upvote

Q: How does the placement cell for B.E. / B.Tech at NIT Delhi assist students in getting placed?

A: 
{Source: B.E. / B.Tech students & alumni}

Placement Cell Assistance

* The Placement Cell at NIT Delhi assists students in getting placed through various means, such as inviting companies for campus recruitment, providing internship opportunities, and offering guidance on resume-building and interview preparation.
* According to students, nearly every student from the CSE department gets placed through the Campus Placements process, with companies like Amazon, Samsung, Paytm, Infosys, Wipro, and many more visiting the campus.
* The highest salary package offered in the Electrical branch was INR10 Lakhs per annum, while the lowest was INR6 Lakhs per annum.
* The average salary package offered was around INR8-9 Lakhs per annum.
* The Placement Cell also provides internship opportunities, with nearly 70-80% of students securing internships from the college.
* Companies like Microsoft, Google, and Amazon have recruited students from NIT Delhi's campus.
* The College encourages students to participate in extracurricular activities, including sports, cultural festivals, and seminars, to enhance their overall growth and employability skills.
Upvote

NIT Delhi Popular Programmes 2025

NIT Delhi popular programmes are BTech and MTech. BTech course students are placed in top companies. NIT Delhi Engineering students can work as Software Engineers, Data Scientists, or Civil Engineers, or can take up any job relevant to their stream. The college aims to develop the full potential of the students whilst offering them an enriched educational experience that largely equips students with the various qualifications and skills to achieve their technical and scientific ambitions.

NIT Delhi BTech students can even go for MTech after getting their undergraduate degrees. NIT Delhi MTech course helps students in fetching great job offers. Overall, NIT Delhi is one of the highest-ranked colleges present in India. Some of the NIT Delhi BTech specialisations are listed below:

  • Civil Engineering
  • Mechanical Engineering
  • Computer Science and Engineering
  • Electronics and Communication Engineering

NIT Delhi Admission Process and Important Dates 2025

The mode of National Institute of Technology Delhi course admissions is online. NIT Delhi admissions to various courses are based on the scores of entrance exams such as JEE Main, GATE, and others. Candidates have to appear for the course-specific counselling rounds such as JoSAA and CCMT to participate in the NIT Delhi admission process. Candidates must have the below list of documents to secure and confirm their seats at NIT Delhi. The list is as follows:

  • Original admission letter and original document verification certificate (Original DVC) -Issued by CSAB/JoSAA
  • Four passport-size colored photographs
  • Provisional seat allotment letter (last round)
  • Mark sheet and certificate of Class 10, Class 12, Diploma, UG, and PG degrees (as applicable)
  • Photo ID proof
  • Undertaking in the required format (for OBC-NCL candidates - if applicable
  • Certificate of Persons with Disability (for PWD category) - if applicable
  • Character Certificate
  • Transfer Certificate
  • Migration Certificate
  • Category Certificate (OBC-NCL/ SC/ ST)

NIT Delhi Application Process 2025

The NIT Delhi application process is majorly online. Admissions to the NIT Delhi BTech programme are based on JEE Main scores, followed by the JoSAA counselling. Candidates who want to take admission to NIT Delhi must appear for the course-specific entrance exams accepted by the institute. After qualifying for the course-specific entrance exams such as JEE Main, candidates must apply for the counselling process. Refer to the steps given below to know more about the JoSAA application process.

Step 1: Register for the JoSAA counselling process on the official JoSAA 2025 website.

Step 2: Select the course and NIT Delhi as the preferred institute.

Step 3: Based on the entrance exam scores and the preferences of the candidates, JoSAA would allocate the seats to candidates in different institutes.

Step 4: Get your documents verified.

Step 5: Report at the institute and pay the admission fee.

In 2024, NIT Delhi was ranked 45 by NIRF under the Engineering category. The Institute is often compared based on fees, eligibility, courses offered, salary package and ranking. NIT Delhi: How to Reach?

To reach the National Institute of Technology (NIT) Delhi, one can follow these directions.

  • The nearest airport to NIT Delhi is Indira Gandhi International Airport (DEL) in New Delhi, which is about 30 kilometers away. From the airport, one can hire a taxi or take the Airport Express Metro to reach the institute. The nearest railway station to NIT Delhi is New Delhi Railway Station, which is about 20 kilometers away. From the railway station, one can hire a taxi or take the Delhi Metro to reach the institute.
  • The nearest metro station to NIT Delhi is Dwarka Sector 21 Metro Station, which is on the Blue Line. From the metro station, one can take a rickshaw or a cab to reach the institute. From New Delhi - NIT Delhi is located in Narela, about 20 kilometers from New Delhi. One can reach the institute by hiring a taxi, cab, or using public transport. From Other Cities - If one is coming from other cities, one can reach New Delhi by bus or car and then follow the directions mentioned above
